entry.et: Middle English, from Latin pausa, from Greek pausis, from pauein to stop

def.dt: :a brief suspension of the voice to indicate the limits and relations of sentences and their parts
:temporary inaction especially as caused by uncertainty :hesitation
:a mark (as a period or comma) used in writing or printing to indicate or correspond to a pause of voice
:a reason or cause for pausing (as to reconsider) a thought that should give one pause
:a function of an electronic device that pauses a recording
